title: How to Reset the Time and Resynchronize the Chimes on an Antique Mantel Clock

steps.title: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the wind-up mechanism.
steps.content: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the wind-up mechanism.

steps.title: Insert the key into the hole.
steps.content: Insert the key into the hole. Wind clockwise only until it becomes difficult to wind. Do not over wind or you will damage the mechanism.

steps.title: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the clock’s hands.
steps.content: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the clock’s hands.

steps.title: Set the time by moving the big hand forward, pausing at the 11 o’clock position.
steps.content: Set the time by moving the big hand forward, pausing at the 11 o’clock position.

steps.title: Listen for the subtle sound of a spring unwinding before moving further.
steps.content: Listen for the subtle sound of a spring unwinding before moving further.

steps.title: Move the big hand to the 12 o’clock position.
steps.content: Move the big hand to the 12 o’clock position. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pause and listen for the clock to strike the number of times indicated by the little hand.
steps.content: Pause and listen for the clock to strike the number of times indicated by the little hand. [3] X Research source If the little hand is on 5 o’clock, it should chime 5 times.

steps.title: Advance clockwise to the correct time.
steps.content: Advance clockwise to the correct time. Make sure you repeat the pauses at the 11 o’clock and 12 o’clock positions as needed until the clock’s face shows the correct time. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the clock’s hands.
steps.content: Open the hinged glass cover of the clock’s face to access the clock’s hands.

steps.title: Move the big hand clockwise to the 11 o’clock position and pause.
steps.content: Move the big hand clockwise to the 11 o’clock position and pause.

steps.title: Listen for a sound like a spring unwinding.
steps.content: Listen for a sound like a spring unwinding. This sound is subtle.

steps.title: Advance the big hand to the 12 o’clock position and stop.
steps.content: Advance the big hand to the 12 o’clock position and stop.

steps.title: Count the number of strikes.
steps.content: Count the number of strikes. An out-of-sync clock strikes a different number of times than the hour the little hand shows.

steps.title: Move the big hand back counterclockwise to the number 9 and pause.
steps.content: Move the big hand back counterclockwise to the number 9 and pause. [5] X Research source You should hear another sound like a spring unwinding. This sound too is subtle. The clock now registers 15 minutes before the hour.

steps.title: Move the big hand forward again to the 11 o’clock position and pause.
steps.content: Move the big hand forward again to the 11 o’clock position and pause. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Listen again for the sound like a spring unwinding.
steps.content: Listen again for the sound like a spring unwinding. Remember, this sound is subtle.

steps.title: Advance the big hand to the 12 o’clock position and stop.
steps.content: Advance the big hand to the 12 o’clock position and stop.

steps.title: Listen and count the number of chimes.
steps.content: Listen and count the number of chimes.

steps.title: Repeat the action until the number of chimes and the hour are synchronized.
steps.content: Repeat the action until the number of chimes and the hour are synchronized.
